results.title: The John Thomas show
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Beyond Productions, Denise Eriksen and Bruce Permezel
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Problem with men”.
Bryan Dawe and John Clarke introduce the delicate areas of impotence and testicular cancer. Testicular cancer can be treated early if picked up through self examination - if left, removal is the only option. Men who have had a testicle removed discuss if, and how the surgery and treatment has affected their lives. They also postulate on why self examination does not receive the same coverage that women’s self examination does. Meanwhile, impotence sufferers and their partners describe their experiences and medical professionals go through the pros and cons of vacuum pumps, self injection and where impotence treatment is heading. We are also shown how to examine for testicular abnormalities.

results.title: The John Marsden video
results.creator_credit: Insight Profile, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Mark Waters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Author John Marsden discusses the theories behind writing a successful novel. Using examples from his own work, he explores the different writing styles he uses in his own works, the way the characters think, and the motivating factors which make the characters come to life on the page. Also includes discussion on sentence structure, imagery, and how to select the right words to captivate the reader.

results.title: The Jogger
results.creator_credit: Perk Productions, Atlantis Films and Steve Karp
results.brief_description: A middle-aged male jogger runs alone thorugh snow-covered Central Park as “the metaphor” for the break-up of a marriage. A dialogue beginning before the marriage and tracing its dissolution, is heard throughout the run. The man’s adult life is traced by the dialogue and raises many questions for the viewer about life and human relations.

results.title: The Job Interview
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions, Eve Ash and Ted Robinson
results.brief_description: A depressed job-seeker is frustrated in his attempts to obtain work. His fairy-job mother encourages him to consider his positive attributes and apply them in his interviews. Features Graeme Blundell Julie McGregor.

results.title: The Job for you
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Alan Anderson
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Employment Service established shortly after World War II, aims at finding a job suitable for the person and a person suitable for the job. Each district office has an up to date list of vacancies in its own and in other areas. Finding specialists for professional employment, placing handicapped people in work and arranging employment for migrants are important aspects of the work, and play their part in building Australia’s future.

results.title: The Job
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins, ABC-TV (Australia) and Michael Carson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scales of Justice Series”.
The Job is a story of naivety. Probationary Constable Leonard Webber has the makings of a good policeman, but his ideals bring him into conflict with his colleagues. His lack of experience makes him vulnerable and his training has not prepared him for the system, how it works and the rationalisation of the double dealings. Rated: M

results.title: The Jimi Hendrix Experience: electric ladyland
results.creator_credit: Isis Productions, Daniel Television, Experience Hendrix, BBC, Nick de Grunewald, Bous De Jong and Roger Pomphrey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classic albums: the greatest records in rock history”.
Jimi Hendrix’s album “Electric Ladyland” is one of the classic rock albums of the 20th century. With songs like “Voodoo Chile”, “Crosstown Traffic”, “Gypsy Eyes”, and “All Along the Watchtower”, it has influenced countless rock guitarists. This documentary, part of the “Classic Album” series, examines both the recording process of the album as well as focusing on the life and legend of Jimi Hendrix. Examining each song on the album, the documentary intersperses interviews with Hendrix’s friends and musicians who played on the album, with footage of Hendrix both playing and being interviewed, photos (including Linda McCartney’s pictures for the album cover), and Hendrix’s notes and journals as well as lots of amazing music. People interviewed include Chas Chandler, Mitch Mitchell, Noel Redding, Buddy Miles, Dave Mason, Mike Finnigan, Steve Winwood and album engineer Eddie Krammer.

results.title: The Jim Stynes story: Dublin's Jim
results.creator_credit: Australian Football Video and David Barham
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Player Profile Series”.
In the early ‘80’s the Melbourne Football Club recruited an Irish schoolboy and by the start of the next decade, Jim Stynes had taken the art of ruck play to new levels and won the Brownlow medal.

results.title: The Jigsaw Man
results.creator_credit: J&M Entertainment, Benjamin Fisz and Terence Young
results.brief_description: Spy thriller inspired by the true story of British intelligence officer and Soviet spy Kim Philby (1912-1988). Having defected to Russia in 1979, Sir Philip Kimberly (Michael Caine), Cambridge graduate and former Director-General of M.I.6 is called upon by the Russians to carry out one last mission. With a different identity and a face altered beyond recognition by plastic surgery, he is sent back to England in the guise of a Soviet citizen to retrieve a secret dossier of names he supposedly hid there several years ago. When he decides to defect a second time the viewer is drawn into a complex web of espionage, counter-espionage and counter-counter-espionage where nothing is as it at first appears. Cast includes Laurence Olivier, Susan George and Robert Powell.

results.title: The Jewel in the Crown. V.5. a Nation Born
results.brief_description: India hovers between dream and nightmare. The British have departed India, the nation is gripped by terror and violence. Long repressed by colonial rule, the vicious feud between Muslim and Hindu now erupts into butchery, rioting and murder. Rated: M
